etymologies: Old English weorc (noun), wyrcan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch werk and German Werk, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek ergon

definitions: activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result

examples.text: he was tired after a day's work
work is still going on in fitting out a new store

shortDefinitions: activity involving mental or physical effort

definitions: mental or physical activity as a means of earning income; employment

examples.text: I'm still looking for work

shortDefinitions: work as means of earning income

definitions: the place where one is employed

examples.text: I was returning home from work on a packed subway

shortDefinitions: place where one is employed

definitions: the period of time one spends in paid employment

examples.text: he was going to the theater after work

shortDefinitions: period of time one spends in paid employment

definitions: a task or tasks to be undertaken; something a person or thing has to do

examples.text: they made sure the work was progressing smoothly

shortDefinitions: task or tasks to be undertaken

definitions: the materials for a task

examples.text: she frequently took work home with her

shortDefinitions: materials for task

definitions: cosmetic plastic surgery

examples.text: between you and me, I think he's had some work done

shortDefinitions: plastic surgery

definitions: good or moral deeds

examples.text: the Clapham sect was concerned with works rather than with faith

shortDefinitions: good or moral deeds

definitions: something done or made

examples.text: her work hangs in all the main American collections

shortDefinitions: thing or things done or made

definitions: the result of the action of a specified person or thing

examples.text: the bombing had been the work of a German-based cell

shortDefinitions: result of action of specified person or thing

definitions: a literary or musical composition or other piece of fine art

examples.text: a work of fiction

shortDefinitions: literary or musical composition or other piece of art

definitions: all literary or musical pieces by a particular author, composer, or artist, regarded collectively

examples.text: the works of Schubert fill several feet of shelf space

shortDefinitions: artistic production of particular author

definitions: a piece of embroidery, sewing, or knitting, typically made using a specified stitch or method.
shortDefinitions: piece of embroidery, sewing, or knitting

definitions: an architectural or engineering structure such as a bridge or dam.
shortDefinitions: architectural or engineering structure

definitions: the record of the successive calculations made in solving a mathematical problem

examples.text: show your work on a separate sheet of paper

shortDefinitions: record of successive calculations made in solving mathematical problem

definitions: a place or premises for industrial activity, typically manufacturing

examples.text: he found a job in the ironworks

shortDefinitions: place or premises in which industrial or manufacturing processes are carried out

definitions: the operative part of a clock or other machine

examples.text: she could almost hear the tick of its works

shortDefinitions: operative part of clock or other machine

definitions: a defensive structure

examples.text: just north of the fort were trenches and the freshly reconstructed patriot siege works

shortDefinitions: defensive structure

definitions: the exertion of force overcoming resistance or producing molecular change.
shortDefinitions: exertion of force overcoming resistance or producing molecular change

definitions: everything needed, desired, or expected

examples.text: the heavens put on a show: sheet lightning, hailstones—the works

shortDefinitions: everything needed or expected

definitions: be engaged in physical or mental activity in order to achieve a result; do work

examples.text: she has been working so hard
an engineer who was working on a design for a more efficient wing
new contracts force employees to work longer hours

shortDefinitions: be engaged in physical or mental activity

definitions: be employed in a specified occupation or field

examples.text: he worked as a waiter in a rather shabby restaurant
Taylor has worked in education for 17 years
I work for Ford

shortDefinitions: be employed in specified occupation or field

definitions: set to or keep at work

examples.text: Jane is working you too hard

shortDefinitions: set to or keep at work

definitions: solve (a puzzle or mathematical problem)

examples.text: she spent her days working crosswords

shortDefinitions: solve

definitions: practice one's occupation or operate in or at (a particular place)

examples.text: I worked a few clubs and so forth

shortDefinitions: practise one's occupation in or at

definitions: (of a machine or system) operate or function, especially properly or effectively

examples.text: his cell phone doesn't work unless he goes to a high point

shortDefinitions: function

definitions: (of a machine or a part of it) run; go through regular motions

examples.text: it's designed to go into a special “rest” state when it's not working

shortDefinitions: run

definitions: cause (a device or machine) to operate

examples.text: teaching customers how to work a PC

shortDefinitions: (of machine or machine part) be or cause to be in operation

definitions: (of a plan or method) have the desired result or effect

examples.text: the desperate ploy had worked

shortDefinitions: have desired result or effect

definitions: bring about; produce as a result

examples.text: with a dash of blusher here and there, you can work miracles

shortDefinitions: produce as result

definitions: make efforts to achieve something; campaign

examples.text: they are dedicated to working for a better future for the generations to come

shortDefinitions: make efforts to achieve something

definitions: arrange or contrive

examples.text: the chairman was prepared to work it for Phillip if he was interested

shortDefinitions: arrange or contrive

definitions: use one's persuasive power to stir the emotions of (a person or group of people)

examples.text: the born politician's art of working a crowd

shortDefinitions: use one's persuasive power to stir emotions of

definitions: bring (a material or mixture) to a desired shape or consistency by hammering, kneading, or some other method

examples.text: work the mixture into a paste with your hands

notes.text: with object and adverbial or complement

shortDefinitions: bring material or mixture to desired shape or consistency by hammering

definitions: produce artistic pieces using a particular material or medium

examples.text: he works in clay over a very strong frame

shortDefinitions: produce artistic pieces using particular material

definitions: produce (an article or design) using a specified material or sewing stitch

examples.text: the castle itself is worked in tent stitch

shortDefinitions: produce design)using specified material or stitch

definitions: cultivate (land) or extract materials from (a mine or quarry)

examples.text: contracts and leases to work the mines

shortDefinitions: cultivate land or extract materials from

definitions: move or cause to move gradually or with difficulty into another position, typically by means of constant movement or pressure

examples.text: comb from tip to root, working out the knots at the end
its bases were already working loose

shortDefinitions: move or cause to move gradually or with difficulty into another position

definitions: (of a person's features) move violently or convulsively

examples.text: hair wild, mouth working furiously

shortDefinitions: move violently or convulsively

definitions: (of joints, such as those in a wooden ship) loosen and flex under repeated stress.
shortDefinitions: loosen and flex under repeated stress

definitions: make progress to windward, with repeated tacking

examples.text: trying to work to windward in light airs

shortDefinitions: make progress to windward, with repeated tacking

definitions: bring into a specified state, especially an emotional state

examples.text: Harold had worked himself into a minor rage

shortDefinitions: bring into specified emotional state
